Globetrotters Engineering is a full-service professional organization based in Chicago that has served the public and private sectors since 1974 in the areas of design, management, and consulting. With 200+ personnel, we draw upon highly qualified and experienced staff with diverse expertise to provide cost-effective, sustainable, and responsive services to our clients.

Globetrotters provides architecture, engineering, construction management, permit plan reviews, facility and property management, consulting, and IT services. We are committed to planning, designing, constructing, and managing quality and sustainable infrastructure projects that play an integral role in the development and success of the communities we serve.

We are seeking an ARCHITECT to help with the design and planning of all retail and concessions projects at O’Hare airport.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for construction administration tasks for active projects under construction including:
Taking job site photos
Monitor construction progress
Ensure conformance with approved drawings, specifications, and building construction requirements.
Complete project construction beginning-to-completion PDFs that are handed off to Chicago Department of Aviation (CDA) after completion of every project.
Coordinate systems shut-down, deliveries, and other-related construction activities with CDA, airlines, and other terminal users.
Assist in preparation of design and construction status reports.
Perform drawing reviews and comments
Schedule, coordinate, and monitor final inspections, close-out, and punch-list preparation and completion. Follow-up on delinquent/outstanding deliverables.
Follow-up on all lease requirements relative to construction including, but not limited to, as-build drawings, occupancy permits, and cost information.
Work with architectural team on upgrading current CDA design criteria, construction criteria, construction integration with internal management information systems.
Attend team meetings and all construction progress meetings.
Provide administrative tasks, filing, and field work in all 3 terminals.
Other duties, as assigned.
Knowledge of other disciplines and directs interdisciplinary coordination;
Detailed knowledge of building codes and industry standards, including ADA;
Perform site visits and issues reports;
Edit/write specifications;
Provide input into standards
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Minimum requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or relative field
5 years of architectural experience
Knowledge and experience in all phases of architectural projects;
Able to communicate design options to a diverse group
Must be proficient in AutoCAD and Revit
Excellent oral and written communication skills

At Globetrotters, you are offered the diverse opportunities that are found at a larger firm, but are within the more collaborative and close-knit environment of a mid-size firm. Your perspective and exceptional skills will be valued here.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Epstein is an established and well-respected 100+ year old Architecture, Engineering and Construction firm. Epstein is currently looking for an architectural Design Professional to join our Chicago office team. The ideal candidate will have 1-5 years of experience. Experience with multi-disciplined teams on commercial and industrial projects is a plus. Revit proficiency is essential.

Prepares architectural plans, renderings, three-dimensional models, and construction documents.
Prepares reports and assists in writing architectural specifications.

Assists in design presentations and business development efforts.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.



Your Impact:


We don't just look at what's in front of us. We're creating what's next. From the innovations we build for our clients to the impact our solutions have on the world, by expanding the limits of what's possible today, we're creating a bright future for everyone.

Do you enjoy positively impacting air traveler experience by innovating more connected and sustainable solutions? At Jacobs, we do as well and are seeking an Architect professional to join our team with a purpose.

Our team is looking to add an experienced Architect in support of a multi-billion-dollar airport capital Redevelopment Program. The redevelopment will occur in the middle of an active airport. The existing terminal and concourses will remain operational while the new facility is built in place in a phased approach. This position allows for the opportunity to be a major contributor to the growth of one of the busiest airports in the world as part of the program management team. The position will report to the Program Design Manager or his designee. This position requires the individual to be based at the airport with the program management team. The position will be as part of a joint venture team and the selected candidate will be hired by one of the JV partners.

Typical responsibilities include:

Assigned work elements will focus primarily on the field of Architecture with a focus on wayfinding, facilities design, design management and design analysis including:
Coordination and oversight of wayfinding elements associated with the program
Stakeholder coordination and management for assigned tasks
Project management of technical needs regarding architectural project/program elements
Provide recommendations for the technical direction of the program
Pre-design support including preparation of Project Definition Documents
Participate in design review process as needed for all program elements
Verify projects comply with program and code requirements
Support the writing of RFQ, RFP and TOSR documents with an architectural project focus
Complete site visits to evaluate and assess site architectural concerns and provide remediation recommendations
Support creation and update of facilities standards and specifications
Evaluation of design alternatives
Provide miscellaneous technical support as required by the program
Prepare detailed engineering drawings and specifications for miscellaneous design assignments as directed by the client
Develop engineering calculations, diagrams and technical reports
Assess potential program risks associated with materials, schedule, and costs.
Other duties as assigned

If you're ready for that next step - let's go!

Here’s What You’ll Need:

Bachelors degree or higher in Architecture from an accrediteed college or university
At least 8 years of progressive experience in design or program/design management of facilities architectural components
Knowledge and experience in design/management and/or construction of terminals and other airport facilities
Specific knowledge of major terminal structural systems and their functionality including integration with unique airport systems such as baggage handling systems, automated people movers, aircraft boarding bridges, etc.
Must have developed the following skills; general construction knowledge, leadership, oral and written communication skills, team work, decision making, judgment, and problem solving
Ability to utilize computer systems as a tool to effectively manage tasks

Ideally You'll Also Have:

Professional registration as a licensed Architect in Illinois
Previous experience working with terminal/facilities wayfinding layout, planning, design and/or installation
Previous experience working on architectural elements of terminal/facilities design at airports
Experience with large aviation capital programs from a program/design management, design, construction, and/or operational aspect

THE CHALLENGE

A Project Architect is a licensed professional primarily responsible for the coordination and development of design documentation for projects of various complexity/scope. Analyze, interpret, and apply applicable codes, regulations, and requirements.

Conduct site surveys and document existing conditions.
Coordinate the architectural design with other team members, disciplines, contractors, owners, and external consultants.
Assist with construction administration duties.
Conduct quality assurance and quality control on own projects and review the work of less experienced team members.
Maintain regular, in-person and punctual attendance.

___________________________

Detailed understanding of all phases of architectural document production and the relationship between drawings and specifications is required.
Knowledge of building construction systems means and methods, materials, and industry standards is required.
Requisite knowledge and ability to apply accessibility codes and applicable building codes is required.
Understanding of the permitting and entitlement process is preferred.
Ability to effectively manage multiple deadlines and priorities is required.
Ability to participate and collaborate in a project team setting is required.
